case.state: Countless stars light the sky again today.
“Every day I am fated to die. When I awake from the sleep I have been sleeping - how long ago did I begin this sleep that I sleep?" The Wing, by Yi Sang.
“Imagination, however high it flies, falls short, however hard it tries. But spirits fit to see deeply invest in what is boundless a boundless trust." That was Faust part Two by van Goethe.
"The most perceptive character in a play is the fool, because the man who wishes to seem simple cannot possibly be a simpleton." That one is from Don Quixote by Cervantes.
“He was said to have survived starvation by eating human flesh, after which he had the strength to tear out the antlers of a living stag with his bare hands.” Hell Screen by Akutagawa.
“I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.” The Stranger, by Albert Camus.
“Truth becomes fiction when the fiction's true; real becomes un-real where the unreal's real." That was The Dream of Red Chamber by Cao Xueqin.

“If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger.” Wuthering Heights by Emily Bronte.
“Talk not to me of blasphemy, man; I'd strike the sun if it insulted me.” That was Moby Dick by Herman Melville, a personal favorite of mine.
“Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth.” Crime and Punishment, Dostoevsky,
“All hope abandon, ye who enter here.” The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri. Many only know Inferno, but it is actually three stories.
“If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.” Herman Hesse's Demian.
“Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.” That was Homer's The Odyssey.
“I cannot make you understand. I cannot make anyone understand what is happening inside me. I cannot even explain it to myself.” Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka.
“Ah, how I rue that what I could have done I did not do!” That is Orlando Furioso, by Ariosto.

“The important thing is moral choice. Evil has to exist along with good, in order that moral choice may operate. Life is sustained by the grinding opposition of moral entities.” Clockwork Orange, by Burgess.
“You will be required to do wrong no matter where you go. It is the basic condition of life, to be required to violate your own identity.” That one is from Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep.
Hmm, does anyone at the table do much reading? I am looking to pick up some new titles.
Are there any other avid readers here, I'd like to find some new titles to pick up.
I'm in need of some new books to read, my current collection is looking quite bare.
You appear well read, my child. I have taken to literature recently due to my new domain and career. Care to share any book recommendations?
You look like one with a good head for literature. I am looking for new novels to read, have you any ones to recommend?
I believe I heard mention of a "literature club", are you looking for new members? I am currently looking for others to share in my taste of literature that aren't my co-workers.
You look a bit maladjusted, my child. Are you quite alright?
You almost remind me of Netzach, only not an alcoholic. I smell a strong odor on you, but not alcohol.
Were you by any chance held in a dumpster for some extended time, my child? You do not look... right.
If you don't mind my asking, are you unable to speak, Komi-san?
You seem quite quiet, my child. Are you incapable of speech, or perhaps prefer not to?
Are you unable to speak, my child? If so, it's not a problem, I am simply curious.
I sense you are a man who is used to running, Dwight. But what from?
You look to be a man who spent a long time running away. From what, I am curious.
Dwight, I am curious. You look to spend a lot of time running away, but what could you be running from?
Such rudimentary clothing, Aloy. It does not appear to be made from a Tailor, how do you expect to survive any encounters?
What a strange manner of dress, Aloy, how do you expect to survive? You should consult a Tailor, I will even give you the contact to the ones A-Corp utilized.
What are you wearing, Aloy? Did you make it yourself? That will not do at all, you should consult a Tailor.
“I care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself.”
“If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends.”

“I can live alone, if self-respect, and circumstances require me so to do. I need not sell my soul to buy bliss. I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all extraneous delights should be withheld, or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give.”
Now you are interesting. Caitlin, was it? I will be keeping my eye on you, I have not felt an aura from anyone that piqued my interest like you...
I wonder what this feeling emanating from you is. At first I thought you just some sickly girl, but now? Is it Distortion, or something else? Only time will tell.
How... interesting. I will have my eye close on you, Caitlin, you intrigue me. I want to see just what this aura around you means.
You have been touched by the Distortion, Cheryl. Am I correct? No, not the Distortion, but something similar. What sort of world did you flee?
The Distortion... no, something similar. More malicious. Just what life did you lead, dear Cheryl?
Cheryl, what sort of life have you lived? I have not seen someone so marked as you, by something evil. I thought it was the Distortion, but no, the Distortion is not evil. Whatever haunts you, is.
So, you are one of those newer Fixers that dress up all fancy for work, yes? It is adorable, Darkness, I love Fixers like you.
Goodness, all that armor. Ohohoh, you must not have enough to afford a Tailor yet. It's cute, seeing Fixers play at being knights.
Are you some Grade 9 Fixer, roleplaying a knight? Adorable, I do enjoy seeing what gimmicks new offices make nowadays.
Say, I notice some strange readings coming from that bag of yours, Hilbert. What did you bring to this game, dear?
You have something in that bag, Hilbert, what are you smuggling? It gives off the same energy as U-Corp products, but I am not sure...
I would like to know what you have in your bag, Hilbert, I can't ignore the strange energy coming from them.

"The Arbiter stalks
Cloaked in shadow's grim embrace.
Another star falls."
I believe that is how those poems go, right Mitama? Haiku, correct?

Perhaps I may try my hand at a Haiku, Mitama.
"The stars light the sky
the watcher keeps them in check.
Why can't she join them?"
I pray I am not as good as you are.

If I may try, Mitama. Ahem.
"Stars of the City
The Obsydian Warden
Massacre, at dawn."
Was that any good?
You were thinking of recommending this place to others, too? I have a few co-workers who could use the stress relief.
I, too, was planning on inviting a few colleagues. I do think they will enjoy the time here.
Perhaps I, too, will invite some friends here. I have many colleagues who could take a load off.
Bow and arrows? How adorable, I have not seen something quite so amusing.
Oh, Shamir, you sweet thing. You really carry around a bow? Oh, I have not seen such a thing outside of a museum.
Oh, thank you, Shamir. I needed the laugh, at seeing that adorable little bow of yours. Would you mind firing one at me, I want to feel it bounce off my cloak.
You are an odd looking man, Steve. Now, why do you give off such an ominous aura?
I cannot decide what is stranger. Your hair, or the fact you give off such an otherworldly aura. What life have you lived?
You are weird, Steve, but in a sort of charming way. I cannot shake that strange aura of yours though, you must tell me what you have went through, where you have been.
You seem to keep looking around, Kyoko. Are you looking for something, or just drinking in the environment? I am curious what causes you to be so vigilant.
The way you carry yourself is not how your average woman would, Kyoko. Tell me, why do you feel the need to be so vigilant? It almost appears you are analyzing the participants here.
You can relax, Kyoko. There isn't anything to analyze yet. I am curious what life you had to make you so cautious of your surroundings, though.
Such a hopeful, energetic girl. My old tendencies rear their head, and I am urged to crush you. Forgive me, Chie, old habits are hard to shake.
Your optimism is adorable, Chie. My natural instinct is to destroy it, and break you. I ask you forgive me, it is simply what I was made for.
I must resist the urge. You awaken some feelings I have tried to purge in myself, but of course they never leave.
Dunban, forgive me if this is too forward, but I find your accent to be incredibly attractive.
I must say, Dunban, I do find your voice very attractive. The accent you speak in is nearly making me blush.
I always was infatuated with your sort of accent, Dunban. It is not too common where I am from, so I have taken quite the liking to it.
Aaravi, you look like quite a seasoned fighter. Are you something like a Fixer? Perhaps a member of a Syndicate?
You look like one who knows combat, someone who has fought and killed many. Are you a Fixer? A member of a Syndicate? You look like you could even be a Color Fixer.
I wonder what you are, Aaravi. A Fixer? A syndicate member? Just another run of the mill murderer?
You are lucky I no longer serve The Head. If I had, I'd have killed you on the spot, for breaching the AI Ethics Amendment. So, Dorothy, it is your lucky day.
Where I am from, sapient robots must be killed immediately upon encountering them. Luckily, we are not where I am from.
The AI Ethics Amendment would call for your death, Dorothy. Be grateful, because I would have disposed of you immediately.
I always hated the pampered rich of the Nests. So boring, so pampered. Maybe someday your Nest will collapse, and you will learn pain.
You really get on my nerves, Kaz. You and those rich, pampered feathers of the Wings.
Bloody feathers, you rich snobs in the Nests. I always delighted in my work, but I could not stand those in the Nests who lived so easily. When was the last time you struggled, Kaz?
So much exposed skin is a great way to die, Lucy.
Bearing so much of your flesh is dangerous. Are you confident, or arrogant?
Exposing so much skin, do you comprehend the dangers that poses, Lucy?
A bow and arrow? Oh, that is adorable, Lyralei.
Such an archaic weapon, have you even spilled blood with such a ridiculous instrument?
Seeing someone with such a foolish weapon is quite refreshing, sensibility has grown tiresome.
A God is only a coping mechanism made by those who seek reason in the unreasonable. Anyone who claims to be one simply wants power.
You call yourself a God, Neptune? Tch, you are no better than the Index. I bet you do so to prey on their desperation, too.
Ugh, another power-hungry fool that wishes to call herself a God. I grow tired of the same ridiculous farce, day after day.
Are you truly blind, Toph? I can not imagine going through life lacking such a vital sense.
To think, you lived so long deprived of sight. You must be an impressive woman, Toph.
I have heard of people replacing their eyes, it is not uncommon to lose body parts. But to willingly continue life without sight is unheard of. How have you lived so long?
Just... what are you, Trixie? I would assume you are a result of the Distortion, but you do not give off that energy.
My first instinct is to assume you are a result of the Distortion, but I have seen that effect with my own eyes. I know the aura of the Distortion, and you do not hold it, Trixie.
I have never seen something like you, Trixie. Are you the Distortion, or are you something else?
A sword that expensive looking makes me assume you are some sort of corporate Fixer, Adora. Perhaps an affiliate of T-Corp or W-Corp?
That sword looks pricey, did your employers cover it? I imagine a Fixer affiliated with T-Corp or W-Corp would have their kit paid for.
Ah, another corporate Fixer with a fancy workshop weapon. Did your employers at W-Corp buy you that? Maybe you work for T-Corp instead?
I hope you are ready to begin, everyone. I pray you do not go too easy on me.
Your willingness to challenge me is admirable, but try not to overwork yourselves.
Tis an ordeal to overcome, for you and for me.
I pray I learn not only the shape of your bodies, but the contents of your minds and hearts. Do hold nothing back.
Have any of you read any good books lately? I hope you do not mind me quoting some of them.
I am excited we all get to be here together, I only hope you did not come in hopes of winning.
Please allow me ~cards.text~, dealer.
Give me ~cards.text~, sir.
~Cards.text~, if you would be so kind.
I will trade away ~cards.text~. Let us see if I can rewrite fate.
Fate is fickle, I'll need ~cards.text~.
I have need of ~cards.text~ more, Dealer.
I shall rid myself of ~cards.text~ and replace them if it is alright.
I would like to swap ~cards.text~, dealer, thank you.
I need only 1, dealer.
Ohoho, nearly perfect. Let me swap 1.
I only need 1 card, are you afraid ~player~?
Just 1 please, dealer.
1 will do, thank you.
If you would be so kind, I only need 1.
How quaint, I only need 1.
1, now, if you will.
How pleasing, my hand is perfect as is.
As an Arbiter always must, I began with the tools I need.
Would you look at that? I need not exchange any cards.
Are you worried, ~player~? I will not be exchanging my cards this round.
Ohoho, how lovely. I was dealt a hand not needing of change.
No cards, dealer. I am satisfied.
Just give me a new hand.
Worthless, give me another one.
I suppose I must start from the beginning.
Nothing of value in this hand.
Are you quite serious? A new hand, please.
These cards are no good, not even one worth keeping.
I've gotten out of tougher. I'll start from the top.
You shouldn't see this.
“As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.”
The Royal Flush, only the best for one like me of course.
I can get used to the royal treatment.
I do not believe I will be losing this hand.
There will be no obstacle I cannot overcome.
One's outlook is what decides many things.
Stars truly do shine brightly, yes?
I am curious, what does a star mean to you?
My apologies, but I will be taking this victory.
I doubt you'll surpass this.
I suppose it will keep me in the game a bit longer.
A little late, but whatever. As long as I am still in the game.
I appreciate it, even if I'm already in a corner.
Good, this will stave off my defeat a bit longer.
I just need to get this lucky for awhile longer.
Good, I am not fully defeated yet.
Excellent, this will surely keep me going.
I have little to worry about, this hand.
You will not expose me any further.
Good, I won't need to take much more off.
This will keep me going, the call of the void is silenced.
Good, I won't be out too soon then.
It could go either way.
Mediocrity at times is more offensive than that which is objectively worse.
So dull, truly this draws my ire.
I do dislike the common mediocrities in life. These cards are amongst the worst offenders.
Nothing remarkable here, I fear.

"O my sorrow, you are better than a well-beloved: because I know that on the day of my final agony, you will be there, lying in my sheets, O sorrow, so that you might once again attempt to enter my heart."
“I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.”
“Calm —indeed the calmest— reflection might be better than the most confused decisions.”
“I have been and still am a seeker, but I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.”
I don't have a great feeling about a hand this... mediocre.
This hand does not inspire hope. It hardly inspires anything.
This is not the time to be receiving such base hands.
Great, this is just what I need. A bland, boring hand while I'm already exposing myself.
Really? It isn't the worst, but really?
Such mediocrity, I just need to hope someone else has a worse hand.
The median is not what I was wanting, but I suppose it can be worse.
This should be enough, for this round.
I pray this is enough to keep me decent.
Will this be enough? I have lost so many times already.
As long as at least one person has a worse hand, this is doable.
Bitter, just as tea is meant to be.
Is this the best I can get at this point?
Such mediocrity does not bode well when I am standing in my underwear...
This bodes worrisome for me.
How very troublesome indeed.
This is not looking to favour me at all.
Well, get on with it. Either I lose or I don't, I have accepted such.
To wish to never lose is a foolish dream.
A star can only truly be seen in the darkness...
Even if a burden that cannot be avoided comes my way, I shan't collapse.
I suppose it was foolish to believe I could avoid it.
Damn you, dealer, you cannot be serious with a hand like this.
This is not a time for piss-poor hands.
A hand like this is not going to suffice.
Such a useless hand, I'm not in a position where I can handle losses.
Oh dear, this might be it for me...
I am already near nude, and this is the hand I must receive?
Goodness, I might have to strip again this round.
I am far from pleased with this hand.
Hardly worth my time, my last cards were better.
I do not think I will avoid stripping this round.
A star can only truly be seen in the darkness...
Dealer, do you really wish to get on my bad side?
I only drink black tea, free of any sugar or milk. Nothing except for the tea itself, anything else would ruin the purity of the flavour. Care for a cup, Dunban?
~player~, you share a name with someone dear to me. I almost wish I could invite her to join us. I did always find her quite attractive.
~player~, hm? "That's that, this is this". That's what he would say. I wonder if he would join if I requested.
I do not think Yesod would ever come here. I doubt he's gotten used to his own flesh. My apologies, ~player~, a co-worker of mine shares your name.
What an uncommon name, ~player~. Frankly, Malkuth could do with a vacation. Such a busy bee, and I would hardly dislike the opportunity of playing with her.
Ah, ~player~, you share a name with one of my co-workers. Hod... she was always quite cute. She was my eyes, I never did... reward her for such good behaviour that day.
You really share a name with her, ~player~? Maybe I'll need to make you my toy, at least until that woman shows up herself...
~player~, you share a name with one of my co-workers. He's a drunk, but I would be too had I been living his life. I think he would enjoy this game.
I wonder, ~player~, do you like tea? Or are you like that blue-haired noble you share a name with, and drink only coffee?
What an interesting name, ~player~. I doubt we'd ever see the Hokma I knew here, he was only ever interested in one man.
What an odd coincidence, ~player~, that we both have the name Binah.
Hmm, do not worry, my child. If you are studying history, perhaps we can compare facts of the worlds we come from?
Worry not, child, I am quite curious in the worlds people come from. How about we discuss history instead?

It is neither, I simply am using a U-Corp Stasis Container to store a cup of tea, and a W-Corp Short-Distance Transportation Device, or an STD, to transport the cup into my hand when I wish. Both are common household products.
Pale? I suppose I do not get much sun, I oft spend my time indoors. The only time I left was as an Arbiter, but I was often in this full uniform. Hardly time to tan.
Yes, I consider myself an avid reader, though I only started thanks to a career change. Currently, I work at a Library, accumulating knowledge and philosophy.
You wound me, Dunban. I know I seem the type to exclusively observe, but I am a woman with needs. I am here for pleasure, the carnal desire of sexuality all humans carry deep within.
Worry not, I did not expect you to understand. I had been working on the assumption that you did not know how to read to begin with, Nagatoro.
I offer my apologies, Jura, I had not intended to cause discomfort. The life I lead has made socialization quite difficult.
I apologize if I had given you those concerns, Jura. I do not intend to treat you like anything besides what you are, I can assure you. I understand if my disposition can cause discomfort.
It depends on which employer. I have changed careers many times. Lobotomy Corporation was the source of all energy in The City, so it held much sway.
In terms of employers, I have had a few. Lobotomy Corporation was an energy company, the only one that was reliable. So, you can imagine it was considered quite important.
Ah, Karl Marx. Since my most recent career had me as a librarian in charge of philosophy I am well versed. Though I suppose literature isn't your thing, Revy?
Karl Marx, the father of Marxism which would later inspire the ideology of Communism. Thinkers like that are who I archived the works of, though I suppose books are not your thing?
Goodness, three losses in a row?
Again? How am I failing so absolutely?
Goodness this was a free fall. How did I fail so absolutely?
Simply losing my cloak is of little consequence when I have such a lead.
This is fine, I needn't keep my cloak on at this time.
This is hardly an issue, I will simply remove my cloak.
I am still much better off than you all, my children. I can afford to shed my cloak.
I am still well off, and besides this cloak can get heavy anyway.
With a lead I am more than willing to take another loss. After all, it is only my shoes next.
Sure, I suppose I will take another loss. My shoes can be the next sacrifice.
So I must strip again? I suppose, next will be my shoes then.
Do not get too excited, I will only be removing my shoes.
I suppose there are those who will get aroused from me removing my shoes. So be it, a price I am willing to pay.
Hardly an issue. I lost once more, so now I must remove my jacket.
It is only my jacket next, I suppose it will make more of my form visible though. But hardly an issue.
A second loss, I cannot expect to be exempt afterall. No problem, I shall take off my jacket next.
I often take my jacket off when I am relaxing anyway, so this is no different than returning from a day of work.
Most would remove their jacket in company anyways, so this is hardly a large loss.
It seems it was unavoidable. Even with my dominance, I must reveal something.
A shame, even though I am winning I still must show some skin. Lucky you.
I will not kick up fuss, I signed up for this knowing I may have to show some skin.
Not a worry, I am still winning after all. Why not give you all some motivation.
My fifth loss, I would be upset but you are all much worse off.
I'm already showing my underwear, so what's one more piece of underwear shown? Besides, I am still winning.
Not a problem, I don't like being those close to the edge, but at least you've begun falling off the side.
I can at least live with the fact I am not the first to bare flesh.
At least I am not the first, that is what matters to me.
Despite the fact it required you to strip down as well, you did succeed in stripping me down this much. Shall I show you your prize?
I might as well join those of you already nude.
I suppose I could not complete this game without baring my body more for you all.
I have lost, so I suppose I shall remove my cloak for you all.
Congratulations on defeating me, you are yet to get a reward though, I am only removing the cloak.
Good work. As per the rules of the game, I shall shed my cloak now.
I doubt this will be all that tantalizing for you, my children. It will only be my cloak.
Hmm, I am starting to run out of items I can take off without exposing too much...
This is troubling, but I am far from the worst off. I can come back from this.
I am far from out, but still, I was hoping to be winning this. I will remove my shoes, next.
I am performing worse than I originally predicted. I will need to focus more.
I do not mind taking my jacket off; I have yet to reveal anything major.
Next will be my jacket, not the most attractive I assure you.
If any of you are particularly fond of a woman's arms, then I suppose this is for you?
A second loss, but I am far from bad off. Let me remove my jacket.
My fourth loss, and I hope my last. Very well, you shall see beneath my shirt.
It looks like I lost again. Next I shall remove my shirt for you all.
My shirt next, not a great sign but I am, luckily, not the worst off.
I see. Well, I can live without my shirt.
Losing my leggings next, you have bent my back more than I expected.
You pushed me a lot further than I expected. My fifth loss.
Well, I suppose you did earn this. Watch closely.
Well, you did it. Now I must bare my body further.
Watch closely, you did earn this after all.
Congratulations, ~player~, you have pushed me to the brink.
I suppose I did sign up for this, I owe it to you now, ~player~.
Not a fantastic start for me, but it is only the first article of my clothing.
My, I am not off to a fantastic start.
Really? I'm behind already? Well, I suppose there's nothing to be done.
Goodness I am underperforming.
I lost again? That is my third loss, and I am the worst one off. I am performing poorly...
Again? I am performing poorly. It is only my shoes, but still, I need to do better if I am to win.
Fine, celebrate your win for now. I will not lose further.
I must rethink my strategy, if I am losing by this wide a margin...
I would prefer to be doing better, but this is fine. It is only my jacket after all.
You are all so overdressed... So be it, I shall remove my jacket.
At least it is only my jacket...
Another loss, next is my shirt. I was hoping to avoid showing so much school this early.
Damn, I am not doing well at all. So be it, enjoy viewing my body without my shirt.
It is more skin than I wanted to show this early. So be it, you did earn it.
Another loss? I swore I would be better than this.
I cannot believe I am losing this much.
Tch, fine. You earned this, so you better witness it.
To think I am losing so easily.
Tch, to be left so utterly defenseless against you all. I truly have degraded.
I came here with the expectation of domination, not this.
Damn, I suppose I lost. Though I am not happy about it.
I bet you only come here to see this sort of thing, right ~player~? You do not seem capable of finding a partner outside of these games.
I was one of the Arbiters of The City. My masters would send me to snuff out rebellion or destroy non-compliant Wings. So, I suppose I was an Arbiter over death itself. I chose who lived or died.
Next are my shoes. I hear some are into this sort of thing, yes? I do not judge.
Next is my jacket, another indicator of the Arbiter. This jacket may not look it, but it can stop any bullet, and almost any blade.
My cloak, the shroud of darkness in which the Arbiter comes. If one is sent after you, it will be a painful end.
Congratulations, now you may gaze upon much more of my flesh. I will not go down easily, however.
Down to my underwear. If one wished me dead, this would likely be the only chance they'd have with a probability above 10%. None of you are actually assassins, are you?
I try not to even bare an inch of skin that I cannot defend. To think now I am exposing my entire chest before a perfect stranger.
Well, there is no way around it. With this, I lay bared before you. Rejoice.

Indeed, my child, it would be heavy if it were made with metal. However, the Tailors strange forms allow them to create incredibly powerful silk out of the victims they consume. Would you like me to bring you some fine silk?
Excellent, you have done well. I am curious to see what memories you shall yield soon.
My arms do not inspire anything like lust, do they? I have yet to find one who finds arousal in arms.
Ah, it feels good to be able to relax...
I look much less intimidating now, yes?
Do you like what you see, my dear? Go ahead, look, I want you to enjoy.
Yes, I did dress up specially for this occasion. If I am to be brought down to my underwear, I may as well wear something attractive.
Feeling your gaze upon me is awakening long-suppressed emotions.
You described yourself as an Agent, are you by chance a Fixer?
Now now, be a good boy for me, okay?
I hope you don't wish for me to avert my gaze. I want to see you in your totality.
My delicious tea, and a show. Make it good for me.
What will you be taking off for us this time, ~name~?
~name~ was the weakest among us, or at least their hand was.
I'm already nearly naked, surely this isn't a problem for you, ~name~.
I've managed to get this far. So can you, ~name~.
Well, at least I'm still in the game.
It would appear I'm still in the game for awhile. Thank you, ~name~, for losing this round.
You are up it seems, ~name~. Go on, do not delay.
Much better you than me, ~name~. Now do put on a good show, okay?
Excellent, I am glad you were the one who lost.
Hah, that is quite good. I was worried I would need to strip again.
Delicious, what a wonderful cup of tea. ~name~ putting on a show for me will be even sweeter.
Were you hoping it would be me, ~player~?
Now for ~name~ to strip for me, how delightful.
Put on a show for me, ~name~.
Please make it good, ~name~, I do not wish to- hah -lose my composure.
Go ahead, bring yourself- ngh -even closer to where I sit.
Good, I was hoping to see you strip more, ~name~.
Good boy, ~name~. Take it off for me. Take it- ngh -off.
Surprised you are still in the game, ~name~.
Surely you cannot be getting flustered now, can you?
Go ahead, it is your time to shine.
Well, ~name~? Do not keep us waiting.
It appears ~name~ is to strip; I will have my eyes on you, my dearest.
A hot cup of tea, and a beautiful woman. What more is needed in life?
Go on, do not be shy, my dear.
It is alright, I do not bite. I mark my property in much more elegant ways.
I am glad it was you and not me, ~name~.
It seems the loser for this round was ~name~.

“The truth may be stretched thin, but it never breaks, and it always surfaces above lies, as oil floats on water.”

“When life itself seems lunatic, who knows where madness lies? Perhaps to be too practical is madness. To surrender dreams — this may be madness. Too much sanity may be madness — and maddest of all: to see life as it is, and not as it should be!”
“For neither good nor evil can last for ever; and so it follows that as evil has lasted a long time, good must now be close at hand.”

“It is one thing to write as poet and another to write as a historian: the poet can recount or sing about things not as they were, but as they should have been, and the historian must write about them not as they should have been, but as they were, without adding or subtracting anything from the truth.”

“I could have sworn that the man's eyes were no longer watching his daughter dying in agony, that instead the gorgeous colors of flames and the sight of a woman suffering in them were giving him joy beyond measure.”

“Still more horrible was the color of the flames that licked the latticed cabin vents before shooting skyward, as though - might I say? - the sun itself had crashed to earth, spewing its heavenly fire in all directions.”
“People used to say that on moonless nights Her Ladyship's broad-skirted scarlet trousers would glide eerily along the outdoor corridor, never touching the floor.”
“I looked up at the mass of signs and stars in the night sky and laid myself open for the first time to the benign indifference of the world.”
“Since we're all going to die, it's obvious that when and how don't matter.”
“I realized then that a man who had lived only one day could easily live for a hundred years in prison. He would have enough memories to keep him from being bored”
“Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure.”

“The cunning waste their pains;
The wise men vex their brains;
But the simpleton, who seeks no gains,
With belly full, he wanders free
As drifting boat upon the sea.”

“When grief for fiction’s idle words

“No remedy but love
